pr_title: [JBTM-3368] provide error messages in the HTTP responses

timeline.message: [JBTM-3368] provide error messages in the HTTP responses

timeline.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText: I changed to "lra" as I can't find any better name. In case, please, suggest me some better.
replies.author: ochaloup

timeline.bodyText: If we are to include the message for 404 not found, it should mention that the requested LRA id was not found. This is too general for a particular case.
timeline.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText: I tried to make this better.
replies.author: ochaloup

timeline.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText: we normally used WARN and ERROR levels to be part of the i18NLogger messages but I assume this is a good idea to use it here as well
replies.author: ochaloup

timeline.bodyText: also maybe better to add this to i18NLogger?
timeline.author: xstefank
xstefank
xstefank

timeline.bodyText: I just wonder whether this is a Response design to redundantly repeat the status in the included response and it doesn't provide a simpler API to include the errorMsg. If not, then this is ok to go.
timeline.author: xstefank

replies.bodyText: That's how I understand it. I was checking if I can do this better but I haven't found it. Any WebApplicationException takes the Response as parameter in constructor and run validity checker where it checks if the status of the response is the same as it's expected by the name of the exception. I can't find another way now.
replies.author: ochaloup
